title: AvgPool3d gives argument error on padding
body_html:
Using a simple average 3d pool gives the following error:

a = nn.AvgPool3d(3, padding=3)
print(a)
TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'padding'

Although the docs do mention that padding is a valid argument (http://pytorch.org/docs/master/_modules/torch/nn/modules/pooling.html#AvgPool3d)

(http://pytorch.org/docs/master/nn.html#torch.nn.AvgPool3d)

I'm running version 0.2.0_3
body_text:

body:
Using a simple average 3d pool gives the following error:

```py
a = nn.AvgPool3d(3, padding=3)
print(a)
```

```
TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'padding'
```

Although the docs do mention that padding is a valid argument (http://pytorch.org/docs/master/_modules/torch/nn/modules/pooling.html#AvgPool3d)

(http://pytorch.org/docs/master/nn.html#torch.nn.AvgPool3d)

I'm running version `0.2.0_3`
